page.title: 05St.Michael:The Deverills
page.content: The{Church of St Michael}at{Brixton {Deverill}was built in the 13th century, though a church has stood on this site since the 9th century. There is a strong local tradition that{King {Alfred}prayed here before his decisive battle with the Danes at Ethandune in 878 AD. It is a beautiful, simple church and unusual, because we can see it almost as it was when it was built. It was restored in the 19th century and the tower is again being repaired. The parishioners of the Deverill Valley have raised Â£13,000 in a year for this work .The tower has a fine medieval bell which was cast in Salisbury in 1400.There is a Norman Font from the church at Imber, given in 1951 when the village was finally abandoned to the Army.A church has stood here for 1100 years,and still worship here regularly.
